org.nise.ux.asl.run

Class ASLBuilder<D,R>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.nise.ux.asl.run.ServiceServerBuilder<D,R>
  • Type Parameters:
    D - Type of <Data> being listened on <listening port>
    R - Type of <Response> to be sent toward service-client

    public class ASLBuilder<D,R>
extends java.lang.Object
    This is the Main Constructor Class of this service library. To use this library create an instance of this class, then use start() to start the service
    Author:
    Yaser Eftekhari ( ^ - ^ )

      • ASLBuilder

        public ASLBuilder(int serverPort,
          ServiceResponserFactory<D,R> serviceResponserFactory,
          java.lang.reflect.Type requestPackageType)
        Parameters:
        serverPort - Server ServiceServer Port
        serviceResponserFactory -
        • A Factory to produce new instances of interface ServiceResponser
        requestPackageType -
        • Use code below to create this parameter
          Type requestPackageType = new TypeToken<RequestPackage<MyClass>>(){}.getType();}
          • where MyClass will be equal to type D

        public ASLBuilder<D,R> setClientInfoProfilerFactory(ClientInfoProfilerFactory<D> clientInfoProfilerFactory)
        Parameters:
        clientInfoProfilerFactory - Factory to produce new instances of interface ASLProfiler
        • Set this factory to implement profiling functionality,
        • If not set Profiling is disabled.

      • setOutputAnalyzer

        public ASLBuilder<D,R> setOutputAnalyzer(OutputAnalyzer<D,R> outputAnalyzer)
        Adds possibility of having a post-response logging
        Parameters:
        outputAnalyzer - interface containing method of Logging or Analyzing output
        • Set this factory to implement profiling functionality,
        • If not set Profiling is disabled.

        val - value for configuration LISTENER_NO
        • Listeners will listen on ports starting from
        • Default value: 1
